sn21.2:1: At Sāvatthī. There the Venerable[n.38] Upatissa was Sāriputta’s personal name.Sāriputta addressed the bhikkhus thus: "Friends, bhikkhus!"
sn21.2:2: "Here, friends, when I was alone in seclusion, a reflection arose in my mind thus: ‘Is there anything in the world through the change and alteration of which sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair might arise in me?’ Then it occurred to me: ‘There is nothing in the world through the change and alteration of which sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair might arise in me.’"
sn21.2:3: When this was said, the Venerable Ānanda said to the Venerable Sāriputta: "Friend Sāriputta, even if the Teacher himself were to undergo change and alteration, wouldn’t sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair arise in you?"
